tweets.text:
Accepting the  @vgr challenge and doing 1 like, 1 opinion on Crypto tribes and culture.

Haven‚Äôt written publicly in a while so pardon the rust. https://t.co/k4EKfAO3L9
Social media brings out the worst elements in humanity. As crypto tribes exist almost exclusively online, this fact is taken to its logical extreme.

Crypto tribes suffer mightily from the tyranny of small differences. Sample members of each tribe on truth serum and you‚Äôd find they got ‚Äúinto crypto‚Äù for similar reasons: frustration with status quo

Yet from crypto twitter you‚Äôd think it was be to see other tribes fail.
If you gave me someone‚Äôs name-redacted resume, I could tell you to which crypto tribe they belonged with 90% confidence.
On average, bitcoiners seem to have best weaponized meme warfare, though there are competent practitioners in most tribes.
Much like politics, claiming to ‚Äúnot have a crypto tribe‚Äù is in fact its own tribe.

Of all cryptos, Bitcoin‚Äôs price action still seems to have the most attention and impact outside of crypto-sphere. 

Attention to bitcoin is (temporarily) ripe for disruption. The fundamentals and value proposition are boringly the same to mainstream.
Considering the vitriol and tech sophistication, I‚Äôm surprised there isn‚Äôt more real world violence or harm (other than cyberbullying) between tribes.
Every member of every crypto tribe is talking their own book.

Channels to find interesting crypto ideas, ranked worst to best

-IRL discussion with boomers
-Mainstream media news
-Most of crypto twitter
-Podcasts
-Blog posts (the older the better)
-Telegram chats
-the book The Sovereign Individual
Inter-tribe peacemaking is a completely thankless job and risks getting you hated and ostracized by both sides. Nasty prisoner‚Äôs dilemma.

It‚Äôs quite obvious that for many, crypto-tribal ascension is their first time being taken seriously by a meaningful group of people or possessing any real ‚Äúpower‚Äù to speak of. 

Interesting to watch the atom bomb given to the infant in real time.
Crypto tribes each have their own ‚Äúpurity tests‚Äù whose stringency/forgiveness seems to align nicely with the mutability of their actual crypto currency.
It's a rare event when any crypto tribe member changes their mind about... anything.
